people.name: David Ben-Gurion
people.description: David Ben-Gurion  was the primary founder of the State of Israel and the first Prime Minister of Israel.

people.name: Cormac O'Raifeartaigh
people.description: Cormac O’Raifeartaigh  is an Irish physicist based at Waterford Institute of Technology in Ireland.

people.name: W. E. B. Du Bois
people.description: William Edward Burghardt "W.  E.  B. " Du Bois  was an American sociologist, historian, civil rights activist, Pan-Africanist, author, and editor.

people.name: Enrico Fermi
people.description: Enrico Fermi  was an Italian physicist, who created the world's first nuclear reactor, the Chicago Pile-1.

people.name: Niels Bohr
people.description: Niels Henrik David Bohr  was a Danish physicist who made foundational contributions to understanding atomic structure and quantum theory, for which he received the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1922.

people.name: Frederick Reines
people.description: Frederick Reines ;  was an American physicist.  He was awarded the 1995 Nobel Prize in Physics for his co-detection of the neutrino with Clyde Cowan in the neutrino experiment.

people.name: Satyendra Nath Bose
people.description: Satyendra Nath Bose , FRS  was a Bengali physicist specialising in mathematical physics.

items.name: The Evolution of Physics: The Growth of Ideas From Early Concepts to Relativity and Quanta
items.description: It is a book about The Evolution of Physics: The Growth of Ideas From Early Concepts to Relativity and Quanta. It says: The Evolution of Physics: The Growth of Ideas From Early Concepts to Relativity and Quanta is a science book for the lay reader, by Albert Einstein and Leopold Infeld, tracing the development of ideas in physics.   The following people are mentioned:  Physics Institute for Advanced Study Max Born The Feynman Lectures on Physics Books about the history of science  And the following place: Rome

items.name: Physics
items.description: It is a photograph about Physics. In a corner, it says:Physics  is the natural science that involves the study of matter and its motion and behavior through space and time, along with related concepts such as energy and force.   There are things written behind: Sean M. Carroll Gunnar Nordström Enrico Fermi   And the following place: Rome

items.name: EPR paradox
items.description: It is a photograph about EPR paradox. In a corner, it says:The Einstein–Podolsky–Rosen paradox or EPR paradoxof 1935 is an influential thought experiment in quantum mechanics with which Albert Einstein and his colleagues Boris Podolsky and Nathan Rosen claimed to demonstrate that the wave function does not provide a complete description of physical reality, and hence that the Copenhagen interpretation is unsatisfactory;resolutions of the paradox have important implications for the interpretation of quantum mechanics.   There are things written behind: Bohr–Einstein debates  And the following place: Rome

It is a book about ??????? ???-?????????. It says: The Bohr–Einstein debates were a series of public disputes about quantum mechanics between Albert Einstein and Niels Bohr.   The following people are mentioned:  Niels Bohr   And the following place: Copenhagen

items.name: The Evolution of Physics: The Growth of Ideas From Early Concepts to Relativity and Quanta
items.description: It is a photograph about The Evolution of Physics: The Growth of Ideas From Early Concepts to Relativity and Quanta. In a corner, it says:The Evolution of Physics: The Growth of Ideas From Early Concepts to Relativity and Quanta is a science book for the lay reader, by Albert Einstein and Leopold Infeld, tracing the development of ideas in physics.   There are things written behind: Physics James Clerk Maxwell Books about the history of science  And the following places: Copenhagen and Paterson, New Jersey
